title: Business & Finance
text:
Intercontinental Exchange will take its cryptocurrency venture public by merging it with a special-purpose acquisition company.

---

The Nasdaq lost 1.3%, with a drop in tech shares weighing on the broader market. The S&P 500 and Dow fell 0.7% and 0.3%, respectively.

---

Tyson and Pilgrim's Pride separately said they had reached deals with a group of poultry buyers to settle price-fixing claims.

---

Steris is in talks to combine with Cantel Medical, a deal that would bring together two big providers of sterilization products.

---

Goldman, JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley moved to delist hundreds of Hong Kong-traded derivatives in the wake of a U.S. blacklisting of some Chinese stocks.

---

Lilly said its experimental Alzheimer's drug helped patients in a small trial, renewing hopes for therapies to fight the disease.

---

Bluebird Bio plans to spin off its cancer-drug unit into a new, publicly traded company this year.

---

Blackstone hired Joe Dowling, the ex-CEO of Brown University's endowment, as co-head of its hedge-fund business.

---

Dr. Martens said it had taken the first steps toward a listing on the LSE.
